Class LST

java.lang.Object
schedulingAlgorithm.PriorityDrivenSchedulingAlgorithm
schedulingAlgorithm.SingleCoreSchedulingAlgorithm
schedulingAlgorithm.implementation.LST
public class LST extends SingleCoreSchedulingAlgorithm
Least Slack Time Scheduling Algorithm (LST).

LST selects the job with the least slack time to execute next. Slack time is typically computed as the remaining time until the job's deadline minus the remaining execution time. This implementation sets dynamic priorities based on a job's computed slack: smaller slack values map to higher scheduling precedence by assigning a Priority derived from the job's deadline, current core time, and remaining work.

Author:
ShiuJia

  • Constructor Details

    • LST

      public LST()
      Constructs a new LST scheduler instance.

      Initializes the algorithm name to a human-readable label and configures the scheduler to use dynamic priorities because LST computes priorities at runtime based on job slack times.

  • Method Details

    • calculatePriority

      public JobQueue calculatePriority(JobQueue jq)
      Recalculates and assigns job-level priorities for the provided job queue according to the Least Slack Time policy.

      For each Job polled from jq, this method computes the remaining work amount as ceil(targetAmount - progressAmount) and computes slack as absoluteDeadline - currentCore.currentTime - remainingWork. The job's current priority is then set to a Priority constructed from that slack value. Polled jobs are added into and returned in a new JobQueue. Jobs with smaller slack receive higher scheduling precedence.

      Specified by:
      calculatePriority in class SingleCoreSchedulingAlgorithm
      Parameters:
      jq - the source JobQueue containing jobs whose priorities will be recalculated; must not be null
      Returns:
      a new JobQueue containing the same jobs with updated current priorities

    • calculatePriority

      public void calculatePriority(TaskSet ts)
      Task-set level priority calculation is not supported for LST.

      LST operates at the job level using dynamic slack calculations. Assigning priorities at the TaskSet level is not implemented in this class. Calling this method will always result in an UnsupportedOperationException.

      Specified by:
      calculatePriority in class SingleCoreSchedulingAlgorithm
      Parameters:
      ts - the TaskSet for which task-level priorities would be calculated (not used)
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - always thrown because task-set based priority calculation is not supported by this implementation
